= mudhour =

== Syntax ==
 variable: '''mudhour''' (Read-only)

== Description ==
The '''mudhour''' variable returns the current hour number in the MUD's internal time system. This built-in variable allows DIL programs to track and respond to the time of day within the game world, enabling hour-based events, scheduling, and conditional logic.

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Access !! Type !! Description
|-
| Read || integer || Returns the current hour number (0-23)
|}

== Examples ==
 dilbegin time_greeting();
 var
    current_hour : integer;
 code
 {
    current_hour := mudhour;
    
    // Time-based greetings
    if ((current_hour >= 5) and (current_hour < 12))
    {
       exec("say Good morning!", self);
    }
    else if ((current_hour >= 12) and (current_hour < 18))
    {
       exec("say Good afternoon!", self);
    }
    else if ((current_hour >= 18) and (current_hour < 22))
    {
       exec("say Good evening!", self);
    }
    else
    {
       exec("say Good night!", self);
    }
 } dilend

 dilbegin shop_schedule();
 var
    hour : integer;
 code
 {
    :check_time:
    hour := mudhour;
    
    // Shop open from 8 AM to 8 PM
    if ((hour >= 8) and (hour < 20))
    {
       if (self.position == POSITION_SLEEPING)
       {
          exec("wake", self);
          exec("say The shop is now open!", self);
       }
    }
    else
    {
       if (self.position != POSITION_SLEEPING)
       {
          exec("say The shop is now closed!", self);
          exec("sleep", self);
       }
    }
    
    pause;
    goto check_time;
 } dilend

 dilbegin guard_duty();
 var
    schedule : intlist;
 code
 {
    // Guard schedule: wake at 6, patrol until 18, sleep at 22
    schedule := {6, 18, 22};
    
    :main_loop:
    pause;
    
    if (mudhour == schedule.[0])  // Wake up
    {
       exec("wake", self);
       exec("say Time for my shift!", self);
    }
    else if (mudhour == schedule.[1])  // End patrol
    {
       exec("say My patrol is done.", self);
    }
    else if (mudhour == schedule.[2])  // Sleep
    {
       exec("say Time to rest.", self);
       exec("sleep", self);
    }
    
    goto main_loop;
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The '''mudhour''' variable is read-only and cannot be modified
* Hours range from 0 (midnight) to 23 (11 PM)
* Used in conjunction with '''mudday''' for complete time tracking
* Common time ranges:
** 0-5: Night/early morning
** 6-11: Morning
** 12-17: Afternoon
** 18-23: Evening/night
* Time calculations often use the formula: `total_hours = mudhour + mudday * MUD_DAY`

== Error Handling ==
* The variable is always available and does not generate runtime errors
* Returns valid integer values (0-23) in all contexts
